Package camzup.core

Class Img

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Img
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Color>
public class Img
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Color>
An experimental class to store image data. Simplifies PImage class: The image color format is assumed to always be in the format 0xAARRGGBB. The pixel density is always assumed to be 1. The width and the height of the image can be accessed, but cannot be directly mutated.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Img.ImgIterator
    An iterator, which allows a image's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

    • get

      public int get​(Vec2 st)
      Gets a pixel color at a UV coordinate. The coordinate should be in the range [0.0, 1.0] ; the function scales the input to pixel dimensions. The color is formatted as an integer in the order 0xAARRGGBB.
      Parameters:
      st - the texture coordinate
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      get(int, int)

    • getPixels

      public int[] getPixels()
      Returns a reference to the pixels array. External modifications to this array will not guarantee proper function of the image; however, it is allowed so that the image can be converted and displayed.
      Returns:
      the reference

    • reallocate

      public Img reallocate​(int w, int h)
      Internal function to reallocate an image's pixel array if the width and height of the image are different. Does nothing if width and height are the same as the old. Does not set new array's pixel colors to the old.
      Parameters:
      w - the width the width
      h - the height the height
      Returns:
      this image

    • set

      public void set​(int i, int source)
      Sets a pixel at an index to a color. Wraps the index by the pixel array's length with floor modulo.
      Parameters:
      i - the index
      source - the source color

    • set

      public void set​(int x, int y, Color source)
      Gets a pixel color at an (x, y) coordinate in pixels.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      source - the source color
      See Also:
      set(int, int, int), Color.toHexInt(Color)

    • set

      public void set​(int x, int y, int source)
      Gets a pixel color at an (x, y) coordinate in pixels. Wraps the x and y coordinate around the image's width and height with floor modulo. Then uses the formula (y * w + h) to convert the coordinate to a pixel index.
      Parameters:
      x - the x coordinate
      y - the y coordinate
      source - the source color

    • set

      public void set​(Vec2 st, Color source)
      Sets a pixel color at a UV coordinate. The coordinate should be in the range [0.0, 1.0] ; the function scales the input to pixel dimensions.
      Parameters:
      st - the texture coordinate
      source - the source color
      See Also:
      set(int, int, Color)

      Parameters:
      st - the texture coordinate
      source - the source color
      See Also:

    • crop

      public static Img crop​(int x0, int y0, int x1, int y1, Img source, Img target)
      Given a top left and bottom right corner, sets the target image to the cropped region of the source.
      Parameters:
      x0 - the top left x
      y0 - the top left y
      x1 - the bottom right x
      y1 - the bottom right y
      source - the input image
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the cropped image

    • crop

      public static Img crop​(Vec2 tl, Vec2 br, Img source, Img target)
      Given a top left and bottom right corner, sets the target image to the cropped region of the source. The coordinates should be in the range [0.0, 1.0] ; the function scales the vectors to pixel dimensions.
      Parameters:
      tl - the top left corner
      br - the bottom right corner
      source - the input image
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the cropped image

    • falseColor

      public static Img falseColor​(Gradient grd, Img target)
      Recolors an image in-place with a color gradient. The image's luminance is used as the input factor.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Color.luminance(int), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float)

    • falseColor

      public static Img falseColor​(Gradient grd, Img source, Img target)
      Recolors an image to a target image with a color gradient. The source image's luminance is used as the input factor.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      source - the input image
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      Color.luminance(int), Gradient.eval(Gradient, float)

    • fill

      public static Img fill​(Gradient grd, Img target)
      Fills an image with a gradient in place. The gradient is horizontal.
      Parameters:
      grd - the gradient
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the image

    • linear

      public static Img linear​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float xDest, float yDest, Gradient grd, Img target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The value is clamped to a range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the origin x coordinate
      yOrigin - the origin y coordinate
      xDest - the destination x coordinate
      yDest - the destination y coordinate
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • linear

      public static Img linear​(Vec2 origin, Vec2 dest, Gradient grd, Img target)
      Generates a linear gradient from an origin point to a destination point. The value is clamped to a range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      dest - the destination
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • opaque

      public static Img opaque​(Img source, Img target)
      Remove transparency from the image by compositing all colors with opaque black. If the target is not the same as the source, then the target is resized and set to the composite.
      Parameters:
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      this image

    • radial

      public static Img radial​(float xOrigin, float yOrigin, float radius, Gradient grd, Img target)
      Generates a radial gradient. This does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that is not 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      xOrigin - the x coordinate
      yOrigin - the y coordinate
      radius - the radius
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • radial

      public static Img radial​(Vec2 origin, float radius, Gradient grd, Img target)
      Generates a radial gradient. This does not account for aspect ratio, so an image that is not 1:1 will result in an ellipsoid.
      Parameters:
      origin - the origin
      radius - the radius
      grd - the gradient
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • rgb

      public static Img rgb​(Img target)
      Generates a diagnostic image where a pixel's location on the x-axis correlates to the color red; on the y-axis, to green.
      Parameters:
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image

    • rgb

      public static Img rgb​(int w, int h, Img target)
      Generates a diagnostic image where a pixel's location on the x-axis correlates to the color red; on the y-axis, to green.
      Parameters:
      w - the width
      h - the height
      target - the output image
      Returns:
      the image
      See Also:
      reallocate(int, int), rgb(Img)

    • wrap

      public static Img wrap​(int dx, int dy, Img source, Img target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using floor modulo to wrap the source. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax.
      Parameters:
      dx - horizontal pixel offset
      dy - vertical pixel offset
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the target image

    • wrap

      public static Img wrap​(Vec2 st, Img source, Img target)
      Blits a source image's pixels onto a target image's pixels, using floor modulo to wrap the source. The source image can be offset horizontally and/or vertically, creating the illusion of parallax. The coordinate should be in the range [0.0, 1.0] ; the function scales the input to pixel dimensions.
      Parameters:
      st - the texture coordinate
      source - the source image
      target - the target image
      Returns:
      the target image
